meanings.definition: A two-dimensional image produced by tomography.
meanings.sent1: The doctor showed me the tomogram of my broken bone.
meanings.sent2: The tomogram revealed a clear picture of the patient's brain.
meanings.sent3: I found it funny how the cat mistook the tomogram for a mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like a tomogram, capturing moments frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The tomogram of the ancient artifact was so detailed, it felt like I could touch it.

meanings.definition: A single slice of a three-dimensional object obtained through tomography.
meanings.sent1: The tomogram of the heart showed a blockage in one of the arteries.
meanings.sent2: Each tomogram provided a different perspective of the tumor's location.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the tomogram of the cake looked too delicious to slice.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like a tomogram, breaking down complex ideas into simpler parts.
meanings.sent5: The tomogram of the mountain revealed hidden caves and tunnels within.
